topic: British Policies and their Economic Impacts

flashcards.back: Objectives: To fight for the rights of the passengers of the Komagata Maru Incident of 1914. Leaders/Members: Hussain Rahim, Sohan Lal Pathak, and Balwant Singh
Objectives: Assisted the government in the task of town planning in Calcutta. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Hastings
Objectives: To investigate the effects of opium on health. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Lansdowne

Chairman: Sydney Rowlatt. Objectives: A Sedition Committee which authorised the arrest, for 2 years without trial, of any person suspected of terrorism living in British India. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Chelmsford

flashcards.front: Southborough Committee OR Indian Franchise Committee (1918-19)?
flashcards.back: Chairman: Francis Hopwood. Objectives: To decide on the issue of franchise. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Chelmsford

Chairman: Richard Feetham. Objectives: It proposed a suggested allocation of subjects between the Center and the Provinces, addressing the division of provincial subjects into Reserved and Transferred categories as well. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Chelmsford
Chairman: Sir Alexander Cardew. Objectives: To improve the conditions of prisoners. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Chelmsford
Chairman: Andrew Skeen. Objectives: To suggest Indianization of the Indian Army. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Reading

flashcards.front: Indian Franchise Committee OR Lothian Committee (1932)?
flashcards.back: Chairman: Lothian. Objectives: The Communal Award of 1932, rooted in the conclusions of the Lothian Committee, instituted distinct electorates and allocated reserved seats for minorities. Notably, the depressed classes were accorded seventy-eight reserved seats. Governor General/Viceroy: Lord Willingdon

mcq.question: Shore Committee (1914) related to?
mcq.explanation: Shore Committee (1914) fought for rights of passengers of Komagata Maru Incident; members: Hussain Rahim, Sohan Lal Pathak, Balwant Singh.

mcq.question: Lottery Committee (1817) assisted in?
mcq.explanation: Lottery Committee (1817) assisted government in task of town planning in Calcutta during Lord Hastings.

mcq.question: Opium Commission (1893) objective?
options: To investigate the effects of opium on health
mcq.explanation: Opium Commission (1893) investigated effects of opium on health during Lord Lansdowne.

mcq.question: Rowlatt Committee (1917) chairman?
mcq.explanation: Rowlatt Committee (1917) chaired by Sydney Rowlatt.

mcq.question: Rowlatt Committee (1917) was?
options: Sedition Committee authorising arrest for 2 years without trial
mcq.explanation: Rowlatt Committee (1917) was Sedition Committee authorising arrest for 2 years without trial of terrorism suspects.

mcq.question: Southborough/Indian Franchise Committee (1918-19) chairman?
mcq.explanation: Southborough/Indian Franchise Committee (1918-19) chaired by Francis Hopwood.

mcq.question: Feetham Function Committee (1918-19) addressed?
options: Allocation of subjects between Center and Provinces, Reserved and Transferred categories
mcq.explanation: Feetham Function Committee (1918-19) proposed allocation of subjects between Center and Provinces, division into Reserved and Transferred categories.

mcq.question: Indian Jail Reforms Committee (1919) chairman?
mcq.explanation: Indian Jail Reforms Committee (1919) chaired by Sir Alexander Cardew.

mcq.question: Sandhurst Committee (1926) objective?
options: To suggest Indianization of the Indian Army
mcq.explanation: Sandhurst Committee (1926) aimed to suggest Indianization of the Indian Army; chairman Andrew Skeen, Lord Reading.

mcq.question: Lothian Committee (1932) led to?
options: Communal Award of 1932, distinct electorates, reserved seats for minorities
mcq.explanation: Lothian Committee (1932) led to Communal Award of 1932, instituting distinct electorates and reserved seats; depressed classes got 78 reserved seats.

mcq.question: Depressed classes reserved seats under Communal Award?
mcq.explanation: Communal Award of 1932 (Lothian Committee) accorded depressed classes seventy-eight reserved seats.

mcq.question: Which committees were under Lord Chelmsford?
options: Rowlatt (1917), Southborough (1918-19), Feetham (1918-19), Indian Jail Reforms (1919)
mcq.explanation: Lord Chelmsford: Rowlatt (1917), Southborough (1918-19), Feetham (1918-19), Indian Jail Reforms (1919).
